howToUseGpx.title: How to use a GPX file

whatIsGpx.title: What is a GPX file?
whatIsGpx.description1: A GPX file (GPS Exchange Format) is a standard format for storing GPS data such as routes, tracks and points of interest. It allows you to follow a predefined route on your sports watch or device.
whatIsGpx.description2: Once you have generated a route with our application, you can download the GPX file and use it on many sports watches and applications. Follow the instructions below according to your device.

garmin.title: Garmin

steps.connect1: Log in to Garmin Connect from your browser
steps.connect2: Click on Training in the navigation bar
steps.connect4: Click on Import or Create a course
steps.connect5: Select the GPX file downloaded from our application
steps.connect6: Once imported, give your course a name and save it
steps.connect7: Sync your Garmin watch with the Garmin Connect app
steps.connect8: The course will now be available in the "Courses" section of your watch
steps.usb1: Connect your Garmin watch to your computer via USB cable
steps.usb2: The watch will appear as a storage device
steps.usb4: Copy the GPX file directly to this folder
steps.usb6: Courses will be available in your watch's Courses menu

garmin.note: The exact folder location may vary depending on your Garmin watch model.

coros.title: Coros

steps.app1: Open the COROS app on your smartphone
steps.app4: Touch the + icon to add a new route
steps.app6: Choose the GPX file downloaded from our application
steps.app7: Give your route a name and save it

coros.warning: COROS watches have a GPX point limit (2000-5000 depending on models). If your route is very detailed, it might be truncated.

appleWatch.title: Apple Watch
appleWatch.description: Apple Watch does not natively support GPX files, but you can use the third-party app WorkOutDoors (paid but very effective).

steps.work1: Install WorkOutDoors on your iPhone and Apple Watch
steps.work2: Open the WorkOutDoors app on your iPhone
steps.work5: Touch Import and select the GPX file
steps.work6: Once imported, the route will be automatically synced with the app on your Apple Watch

alternativesList.viewRanger: ViewRanger: Free, syncs with Apple Watch
alternativesList.komoot: Komoot: Turn-by-turn navigation (full features with subscription)

appleWatch.note: WorkOutDoors is generally considered the best app for following GPX routes on Apple Watch due to its detailed maps and low battery consumption.

polar.title: Polar

steps.flow1: Log in to Polar Flow from your browser
steps.flow4: Select the GPX file downloaded from our application
steps.flow5: Give your route a name and save it
steps.flow6: Sync your Polar watch with the Polar Flow app
steps.flow7: Access the route on your watch via the Routes menu

polar.warning: Not all Polar models support route navigation. Check your watch's compatibility.

suunto.title: Suunto

steps.app1: Open the Suunto app on your smartphone
steps.app2: Press the map icon (or Plan & Navigate)
steps.app7: The route will now be available in your watch's Navigation menu
steps.moves2: Go to the Planning & Route Creation section
steps.moves4: Select the GPX file and save the route

suunto.note: Suunto has migrated from Movescount to the Suunto app. If you have a newer watch, use the Suunto app.

smartphone.title: Smartphone Applications
smartphone.description: Popular apps for using GPX files

steps.step4: Touch the + symbol then Import a GPX file

steps.step1: Open AllTrails in your browser (not available in the app)

steps.step2: Go to Menu then My Routes

smartphone.note: Most running, hiking and navigation apps support GPX file import. Some features may require a subscription.

generalTips.title: General tips
generalTips.subtitle: For optimal use of GPX routes

battery.title: Battery life
battery.description: Following a GPX route consumes more battery than normal recording. Make sure your watch is well charged before leaving.

complexity.title: Route complexity
complexity.description: A very detailed GPX file with many points can slow down some devices. If you encounter problems, try a simplified version of the route.

alerts.title: Deviation alerts
alerts.description: Configure route deviation alerts in your device settings to be notified if you stray from the planned route.

offline.title: Offline mapping
offline.description: For areas with poor network coverage, download offline maps before your outing.

safety.title: Safety
safety.description: Don't constantly stare at your watch while running. Pay attention to your environment and consult the route only when it's safe to do so.

generalTips.test: Test the import and navigation on your device before leaving for a long outing. This will allow you to familiarize yourself with the interface and features.
